block.p: BioShield Technologies Inc. of Norcross, Ga., plans to acquire AHT Corporation, a Greenburgh developer of software for medical e-commerce, in a stock swap valued at about $20 million, Arthur Dague, a spokesman for AHT, said.

BioShield Technologies Inc. of Norcross, Ga., plans to acquire AHT Corporation, a Greenburgh developer of software for medical e-commerce, in a stock swap valued at about $20 million, Arthur Dague, a spokesman for AHT, said.

Upon completion of the merger, BioShield will integrate AHT's business-to-business laboratory and prescription transaction management operations with its eMD.com Internet healthcare subsidiary, which provides an Internet service for physicians, other health providers and patients.

The combined entity will offer a full array of e-tools to manage laboratory orders and results and prescriptions in doctors' offices. One AHT program, Dr. Chart, allows doctors to order laboratory results and receive the results by way of the Internet. The company also has software called @Rx, which allows doctors to send prescriptions over the Internet.
